snippet: The effort to get assistance to the hardest-hit in Abi Barak was being hampered by a lack of effective management at the site of the landslide.
abstract: Effort to get assistance to those hardest hit by a devastating landslide in Abi Barak, Afghanistan, is being hampered by host of problems, including competing interests among local leaders and politicians and lack of infrastructure and effective management; landslide is likely to have claimed 2,100 lives and has left thousands homeless.

byline.original: By HABIB ZAHORI and AZAM AHMED

lead_paragraph: The effort to get assistance to the hardest-hit in Abi Barak was being hampered by a lack of effective management at the site of the landslide.

headline.main: Lack of Orderly Means to Distribute Aid Is Latest Setback for Afghan Village
headline.print_headline: Lack of Orderly Means to Distribute Aid Is Latest Setback for Afghan Village

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies
